intro: Oryza eichingeri var. longearistata, commonly known as the long-haired ricegrass, is a rare and lesser-known grass species native to specific regions of Africa. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with long, silky hairs along the leaf blades and stems. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grassland or wetland habitats. Its botanical features include narrow leaves and small, spikelet-based flowers that contribute to its distinctive morphology. Due to its limited distribution and unique traits, it holds interest for botanists and conservationists alike.
